Even after all these years, Half Life 2 will remain one of the greatest FPS's ever made. No other FPS has created such immersion as HL2. The storytelling and puzzles are on point and the gunplay is simple enough to allow non-FPS players an enjoyable experience based solely on the story.
10 years later it's still the best shooter of all time.

When i first started video gaming, it was at the time where if you didn't play COD, you would be made fun of until no end.  I noticed in gamestop half life 2 multiple times, and I thought it looked ridiculous, and then i purchased COD: Black Ops 1.  I found out about Steam through one of my friends back in 2011.  A year later, I decided to give Half Life 2 a try.  I was stunned before the intro ended.  This game gave off such a good vibe to myself that I have never felt in any COD.  The source engine was amazing for its time, and it still is today.  This game seems to include an early version of battlefield's "levolution", an example being where you can destroy a whole bridge with some explosives.  This game, along with its predecessor, set the rules and benchmarks for all games following.  I felt many different emotions during this game, such as being excited when in CQB with the combine, and being scared or creeped by the ambient sounds when driving across the coast.  Each level is completely different from the last and the next, but still maintains that strong feel to it.  The weapons are pretty interesting, especially the Gravity Gun.  However, I wish there were more weapons included.  The AI felt real, I felt like I was there with most of the rebels as we fought alongside each other in the street.  If you do not buy this game, you should be ashamed.  This is a true blockbuster, and I am anxious for a sequel.  14/10

Side Note:
I was interested in making a mod for this game.  I was interested in making a bigger focus on the rebel storyline and commanding squads part of the game, but still having a solo story like Gordon.  However, my Hammer editor for mapping isn't working.  When I click new project, it doesn't show a grid, even though the option for one is selected.  If anyone could help me with mapping, that would be appreciated.  Thank you.

One of the few games I have enjoyed in recent times. I don't like shooters, I dislike first person shooters even more, and I don't normally like western games. Despite of being all three, this just got to be one of my favorite games of all times. Released 10 years ago, and I played it for the first time now and I enjoy it. This game stands the test of time. Breathtaking soundtrack, awesome voice acting, neat physics engine that makes some fun puzzzles, fun combat. Simply: play this game. HIGHLY reccomended.

Half-life 2, one of the most games that many people loved it.. Now lemme review this!~
Half-life 2 is a sequel of Half-life 1 which it continues it's storyline.. you will play as Gordon Freeman, who is a scientist on Black Mesa.. he gotten a nasty incident on Black Mesa.. now he's back to fight as himself again on City 17..

Now let's review it's gameplay..
The Gameplay is very cool.. I gotta say.. I've been derping around with this game aswell using console.. but It's still fun, it has a bit horror but it's not that scary guys.
Now Let's review the graphics!
Okay not a PS3 or Xbox fan here, I play this game on 1080p on it's highest settings.. the graphics isn't that bad at least.. It's still runnable with low-end computers.
Let's review It's AI *Artifical Intelligence*
Now the AI in this game is a bit buggy.. but It's still a excellent work for it.. 
Engine?
Source Engine 
Now I highly suggest people who really loves Half-life Series out there! Buy this game now!

Really solid title. It's kinda old but definitely fun gameplay wise. You have many weapons at your disposal (gravity gun is just as awesome as it sounds), the enemies are interesting, ranging from Combine soldiers and their weapon arsenal to Xen lifeforms, and there are no two different chapters that feel the same. Physics puzzles are not bad, even though i am not fun of and sometimes it wasn't obvious what am i allowed to do (like using a valve to flood a building). Graphics aged but aged well and the soundtrack is COOL ! Plot wise it's a really good game due to ingenious Half Life's universe concept. Definitely a recommendation from me.

This is a game I recommend everyone play at least once. 

Despite being released over a decade ago, Half Life 2 has aged incredibly well. Even today, the game oozes a rich atmosphere that immediately draws you in during the opening sequence and compels you to play to completion.

The gameplay is engaging throughout, with a variety of weapons that gradually become available to the player, ranging from the series' iconic crowbar to powerful energy-based weaponry. Combat is not all there is to do, however, as the game is littered with puzzles to solve and a treasure trove of secrets to discover.

The level-design is also unwaveringly immersive. It is difficult to put into words, but each and every "level" feels detailed and well thought-out. The relatively horror-oriented Ravenholm stage roughly halfway through the game is a particularly good example of this.

Furthermore, the story is told effectively though both details in the environment and with a small but interesting cast of characters (Dr. Kleiner is my personal favorite). The characters feel particularly "alive" thanks to excellent animation for the time along with great writing and voice-acting. A few other reviews on Steam do not recommend Half Life 2 based on the fact that the long-awaited third installment has yet to be released and thus the series lacks a conclusion, but I say it is absolutely worth experiencing Half Life 2's story despite that.

Due to it being revolutionary for its time and a classic that holds up exceptionally well today, Half Life 2 gets my highest possible recommendation.
